page.title: 15WHALTON'S HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: Most of the houses in Whalton are 19th century in origin. The exceptions are: {The Manor House:}The 17th century houses which make up the present Manor House were converted and extended by Sir Edwin Lutyens in 1908. Gertrude Jekyll helped to design the gardens. {Ogle Castle:}Built in the 14th century it is now a beautiful private house surrounded by a double moat which was renovated in Victorian times. {The Old Rectory:}Built around a Pele Tower, it acted as the rectory for St. Mary Magdalene until 1958 when the red brick rectory was built beside the church. Until the forties a foot bridge led from its garden to the church, the stone steps of which can still be seen. {Moore House: }A large family house built in the 17th century for the Moore family.
